name: Coastal Protection
description: This goal measures the amount of protection certain coastal habitats provide by measuring the current area they cover relative to the area they covered in the recent past.

name: Coastal Livelihoods & Economies
description: This goal aims to maintain coastal and ocean-dependent livelihoods and productive coastal economies while also maximizing livelihood quality.

name: Livelihoods
description: This subgoal evaluates the benefits people obtain from the oceans in the form of jobs and wages.

name: Economies
description: This subgoal captures the economic value associated with marine industries.

name: Sense of Place
description: This goal aims to capture the level of protection for aspects of the coastal and marine system that contribute to a person's sense of cultural identity.

name: Iconic Species
description: This subgoal captures the species that are important to a region because they are relevant to local cultural identity.

name: Lasting Special Places
description: This subgoal captures the conservation status of geographic locations that hold significant aesthetic, spiritual, cultural, recreational, or existence value for people.

name: Biodiversity
description: This goal captures the conservation status of marine species.

name: Habitats
description: This subgoal measures the condition of habitats that are important for supporting a wide array of species diversity.

name: Species
description: This subgoal aims to estimate how successfully the richness and variety of marine life is being maintained.

name: Tourism & Recreation
description: This goal captures the value people have for experiencing and taking pleasure in coastal areas.
